008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import ij.ImagePlus;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * ImageJ plugin for a median filter of arbitrary size. 
020 * An array {@code A} of type {@code int} is defined to hold the regionâ€™s pixel 
021 * values for each filter position (u, v). 
022 * This array is sorted by using the standard Java method
023 * {@link Arrays#sort(int[])}. 
024 * The center element of the sorted vector ({@code A[n]}) is
025 * taken as the median value and stored in the original image {@code ip}.
026 * See Sec. 4.1.2 (Prog. 4.5) of [1] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
030 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 *
035 */
036public class Filter_Median implements PlugInFilter {
037
038        /** Filter radius. */
039        public static int R = 3; // the size of the filter is (2R+1)x(2R+1)
040
041        @Override
042        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
043                return DOES_8G;
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
048                int M = ip.getWidth();
049                int N = ip.getHeight();
050                ImageProcessor copy = ip.duplicate();
051
052                // vector to hold pixels from (2R+1)x(2R+1) neighborhood:
053                int[] A = new int[(2 * R + 1) * (2 * R + 1)];
054                
055                // index of center vector element n = 2(R^2 + R):
056                int n = 2 * (R * R + R);
057                
058                for (int u = R; u <= M - R - 2; u++) {
059                        for (int v = R; v <= N - R - 2; v++) {
060                                // fill the pixel vector A for filter position (u,v):
061                                int k = 0;
062                                for (int i = -R; i <= R; i++) {
063                                        for (int j = -R; j <= R; j++) {
064                                                A[k] = copy.getPixel(u + i, v + j);
065                                                k++;
066                                        }
067                                }
068                                // sort vector A and take the center element A[n]:
069                                Arrays.sort(A);
070                                ip.putPixel(u, v, A[n]);
071                        }
072                }
073        }
074
075}
